required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optical Coherence Tomography Angiography and Pseudophakic Cystoid Edema
clinical_study.official_title: Peripapillary Vascular Density in the Pathogenesis of Pseudophakic Cystoid Edema

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the retinal vascular features in macula and papillary regions in patients affected by pseudophakic cystoid edema using optical coherence tomography angiography

detailed_description.textblock:
Pseudophakic cystoid edema represents one of the most common causes of poor visual outcome following cataratta surgery.
It is still source of debate the pathogenesis of Pseudophakic cystoid edema. Optical coherence tomography angiography represents a novel and non-invasive diagnostic technique that allows a detailed analysis of retinal vascular features. The study evaluates retrospectively the changes in optical coherence tomography angiography parameters at baseline and after three monthly after surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: OCTA and pseudophakic cystoid macular oedema
primary_outcome.description: The parameters analyzed by OCTA three months after surgery are: Vessel density (%) of superficial capillary plexus, deep capillary plexus, coriocapillary plexus in macular region Vessel density (%) of radial peripapillary capillary plexus in papilllary region

arm_group.description: Subjects over 18 years that after cataract surgery, showed pseudophakic cystoid macula edema.
Normal subjects over 18 years that did not show pseudophakic cystoid macula edema.

intervention.description: Patients underwent OCT angiografia after cataract surgery

study_pop.textblock: The participans were older than 18 years with diagnosis of pseudophakic cystoid macular oedema. The participans did not present other ophthalmological diseases.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age older than 60 years
- diagnosis of pseudophakic cystoid macular oedema
- treatment-naïve for pseudophakic cystoid macular oedema
- absence of other ocular diseases, responsible for macular edema (retinal vein occlusion, diabetic retinopathy, age-related macular degeneration)
Exclusion Criteria:
- age younger than 60 years
- No diagnosis of pseudophakic cystoid macular oedema
- previous treatment for pseudophakic cystoid macular oedema
- presence of other ocular diseases, responsible for macular edema (retinal vein occlusion, diabetic retinopathy, age-related macular degeneration)
